com.centurylink.mdw.monitor

Interface ServiceMonitor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    RegisteredService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServiceTraceMonitor

    public interface ServiceMonitor
extends RegisteredService
    ServiceMonitors can be registered through @RegisteredService annotations to intercept service calls handled by the MDW framework. Must be threadsafe. Normally all registered monitors are called in sequence. However the first monitor whose onHandle() returns non-null breaks the chain, and this non-null response is passed back to the consumer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      java.lang.Object onError(java.lang.Throwable t, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers) 
      java.lang.Object onHandle(java.lang.Object request, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
      Called after onRequest(), but before the appropriate handler is determined.
      java.lang.Object onRequest(java.lang.Object request, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
      Called when the request comes in.
      java.lang.Object onResponse(java.lang.Object response, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
      Called before the response is sent out from the MDW event handler or camel route.

    • Method Detail

      • onRequest

        java.lang.Object onRequest(java.lang.Object request,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                    throws ServiceException
        Called when the request comes in. Can change the incoming request contents. Currently must return null or a String.
        Parameters:
        request - Incoming request message content (String, XMLBean, JAXB Element, JSONObject, etc).
        headers - Incoming protocol header values. May be modified by the monitor.
        Returns:
        null, or an alternative request that should be passed on instead of the incoming request
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • onHandle

        java.lang.Object onHandle(java.lang.Object request,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                   throws ServiceException
        Called after onRequest(), but before the appropriate handler is determined. Can be used to short-circuit the request. Currently must return null or a String. Returning non-null from here bypasses onResponse() and other monitors' onHandle().
        Parameters:
        request - Incoming request message content (String, XMLBean, JAXB Element, JSONObject, etc).
        headers - protocol headers
        Returns:
        null, or an alternative response to send back to the service consumer
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • onResponse

        java.lang.Object onResponse(java.lang.Object response,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                     throws ServiceException
        Called before the response is sent out from the MDW event handler or camel route. Currently must return null or a String.
        Parameters:
        response - Outgoing response message content (probably a String, XMLBean or JAXB Element)
        headers - Outbound protocol header values. May be modified by the monitor.
        Returns:
        null, or an alternative response to send back to the service consumer.
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • onError

        java.lang.Object onError(java.lang.Throwable t,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
        Parameters:
        t - Throwable error that was encountered
        headers - service meta information
        Returns:
        alternate response or null
